episodes.title: The World's music feature this week: Contrabanned at SXSW
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: The World is part of a very cool project at the upcoming South by Southwest festival in Austin, Texas. We've collaborated on a showcase called Contrabanned: #MusicUnites.
tags: Music, Arts, Culture & Media

episodes.title: In communist Poland, the punk thing to do was to sing in English
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: Polish musician Tomek Lipinski heard his first punk album on a cassette tape in 1978. That tape changed his life.
tags: Music, Global Politics, Arts, Culture & Media, Politics

episodes.title: Haiti's 'original boy band' called it quits. Here's how they got their start.
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: This past summer, an iconic Haitian band called it quits. Carimi wasn't just another pop group, though. It was Haiti's original boy band.
tags: Music, Arts, Culture & Media

episodes.title: RIP swimming pigs: Several of the Bahamas' beloved porkers found dead
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: In the Bahamas, there are beaches where you can swim with pigs. And lots of selfie-happy tourists did — until recently.
tags: Culture, Arts, Culture & Media

episodes.title: Guess what? Shakespeare didn't start the theater scene in England.
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: Shakespeare's London theater was only one of many open at the turn of the 17th century. A new project is aiming to rediscover some of those forgotten masterpieces.
tags: Arts, Culture, Arts, Culture & Media

episodes.title: A Korean adoptee meets his birth mother and winds up moving in with her
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: International adoption rules don't make it easy for adoptees and their biological families to search for one another. But many Korean adoptees are going abroad to find their birth families and build new ties.
tags: Culture, Arts, Culture & Media

episodes.title: Fighting for press freedom with the Polish national anthem
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: A year ago in Poland, the government passed a law gaining stricter control over state media. At the time, Kamil Dabrowa was the program director for Polish Radio 1 and he decided he couldn't be silent. He lost his job after taking to the airwaves with a protest in the form of a patriotic song.
tags: Media, Global Politics, Arts, Culture & Media, Politics

episodes.title: Meet Zhdun, the tubby gray blob who's at home on Russian social media
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: It's not a cross between an elephant seal and the Pillsbury Doughboy. Russian internet users call the creature Zhdun, "the one who waits."
tags: Culture, Media, Global Politics, Arts, Culture & Media, Politics

episodes.title: Contrabanned: #MusicUnites — a SXSW music showcase highlighting artists from the seven banned nations
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: President Donald Trump's proposed immigration ban has left many musicians with a lot of uncertainty. To that point, The World is part of a very cool project — a new showcase at the upcoming SXSW festival highlighting artists from some of the seven banned countries.
tags: Music, Global Politics, Arts, Culture & Media, Politics

episodes.title: Iranian scientist who accepted Oscar says US is turning away the best and brightest
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: Everyone's talking about the "Moonlight"-"La La Land" mix-up. But a different moment caught our attention.
tags: Arts, Culture, Media, Arts, Culture & Media

episodes.title: Drummer Mickey Hart recalls 30 years of 'world music'
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: This year is the 30th anniversary of the phrase "world music." This year, we're touching base with artists who were attracted to global sounds or who became champions of those sounds to reflect on what this thing, world music, is. Today, we're talking to Mickey Hart, drummer for the Grateful Dead.
tags: Music, Arts, Culture & Media

episodes.title: Director Damien Chazelle on the old Hollywood musicals that inspired ‘La La Land’
episodes.author: Studio 360
episodes.summary: He talks about Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers, nostalgia and the tension in “Pulp Fiction.”
tags: Arts, Culture, Media, Arts, Culture & Media

episodes.title: Composer and pianist Clara Schumann achieves a modern milestone
episodes.author: Studio 360
episodes.summary: Clara Schumann was one of 19the Century Europe's most well-known pianists. She was also a composer, but her husband, Robert Schumann, eclipsed her in this realm. A recording of one of Clara's piano trios has now been inducted into a prestigious collection at the Library of Congress — putting her, at least in one small way, on a par with her better-known spouse.
tags: Music, Arts, Culture & Media

episodes.title: Macedonia is infamous for fake news. This woman is trying to combat it with real journalism.
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: Macedonia came under the spotlight for generating pro-Trump fake news during the US elections. But this Macedonian is doing everything she can to stop its spread.
tags: Media, Arts, Culture & Media

episodes.title: Unlikely roommates: A Holocaust survivor and grandchild of Nazis share a home in California
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: It’s not just the six-decade age gap that sets these roomies apart.
tags: Arts, Conflict, Global Politics, Lifestyle, Religion, Arts, Culture & Media, Conflict & Justice, Politics, Lifestyle & Belief

episodes.title: The World's music features this week: Bulgaria National Radio, Carlos G Lopes and Graveola
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: Each week on The World, we feature a unique selection of musicians, and every week we put it together for you here.
tags: Music, Arts, Culture & Media

episodes.title: Poland’s right-wing government thinks this WWII museum isn’t ‘glorious’ enough
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: As we adjust to a present of "alternative facts," there are still battles going on over the facts of the past. Like in Poland, where the Museum of the Second World War is embroiled in a standoff with its own government over the correct version of history.
tags: Culture, Media, Education, Arts, Culture & Media, Development & Education

episodes.title: Denmark's dark past is up for an Oscar
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: Inspired by real events, the movie "Land of Mine" tells the story of a group of young German POWs who are captured by the Danish army and forced to dig up land mines along Denmark's coast.
tags: Arts, Media, Conflict, Justice, Arts, Culture & Media, Conflict & Justice

episodes.title: Meet the millionaire teaching Syrian refugees how to be Canadian, his way
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: Do you have to be a vegetarian non-smoker to be successful as a Syrian refugee in Canada? Jim Estill says yes.
tags: Culture, Economics, Conflict, Arts, Culture & Media, Business, Economics and Jobs, Conflict & Justice

episodes.title: Paris’s museum of recorded sound enjoys a reprieve
episodes.author: PRI's The World
episodes.summary: One of Paris's newest museums features crazy antique audio equipment, like a phonograph from the 1920s shaped like a ski chalet. But the museum almost had to close last year.
tags: Culture, Arts, Culture & Media
